messages.message:
I think the size limit exists because of our file upload service too.

For number of pages, this is a good point. What is our latest limit? I know a while ago we were discussing 50, but I've seen quite a few important docs like 10Ks that reach 80ish pages. 100 would be a more reasonable limit for us to consider

The size limit exists because of the way we chose to upload files - currently the application chooses to upload the file in one request, which means if the request payload is too large it places the backend services at risk. File service supports multipart upload though, it is just that the document endpoint did not implement this. Furthermore, it is a good practice to limit how much a user can upload anyway because we only have so much resources

Makes sense, it seems reasonable that we need to have a limit here. But just wondering if:
1. It should be higher, I ran into this a few times with large files (UN sustainable development goals, Adani hindenburg report, HBR case study - all of which were under 25MB, but that is a huge jump).
2. We should add tips for the user to compress the file if they cross the limit in the error message
I don't see a huge problem of bumping from 10 to 25 MB. I don't know how much it can affect the digitization if users upload zipped files
@Hari, will know the impact on digitization
For folder upload, do we need the entire folder to be less than 10MB? Or each file in the folder?
That i don't know, I got the impression 10MB is per file. @Vasu implemented the endpoint
It's a per file limit, not the entire folder.
@avi zip files are not supported for digitization.
Confirming that I can upload a 12MB folder with all files within it less than 10MB
